com.meteorcode.pathway.io

Class ZipEntryFileHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meteorcode.pathway.io.FileHandle
      • com.meteorcode.pathway.io.ZipFileHandle
        • com.meteorcode.pathway.io.ZipEntryFileHandle

  • public class ZipEntryFileHandle
extends ZipFileHandle
    A FileHandle into a file or directory within a zip archive.

    DON'T MAKE THESE - if you want to handle a file, please get it from ResourceManager.handle(). The FileHandle system is supposed to allow you to treat files in zip/jar archives as though they were on the filesystem as regular files, but this only works if you treat all files you have to access as instances of FileHandle. If you ever refer to files as DesktopFileHandle, com.meteorcode.pathway.io.ZipFileHandle, ZipFileHandle, or JarFileHandle explicitly in your code, you are doing the Wrong Thing and negating a whole lot of time and effort I put into this system. To reiterate: DO NOT CALL THE CONSTRUCTOR FOR THIS.

    See Also:
    ResourceManager

      • isDirectory

        public boolean isDirectory()
        Description copied from class: ZipFileHandle
        Returns true if this file is a directory.

        Note that this may return false if a directory exists but is empty. This is Not My Fault, it's java.util.File behaviour.

        Overrides:
        isDirectory in class ZipFileHandle
        Returns:
